snippet: Imports experienced a deeper decline than expected, which suggested that the nation’s economy was slowing.
abstract: China reports exports fell 0.5 percent in January from a year earlier to $149.9 billion, while imports were down 15 percent at $122.7 billion; its trade surplus tripled compared with year-ago January to $27.3 billion.
lead_paragraph: Imports experienced a deeper decline than expected, which suggested that the nation’s economy was slowing.

headline.main: In Sharp Trade Drop, Hint of Slowing China
headline.print_headline: In Sharp Trade Drop, Hint of Slowing China
